page.title: 03SELF SUFFICIENCY
page.content: There are two cottages opposite Lynes Barn Farm. Both are rented to young couples by the farmer. They only moved in a few weeks before our survey. One man is a free-lance gardener who is hoping to develope the garden to be more or less self sufficient. He keeps fancy hens and and eventually hopes to keep goats. He has planted some vegetables in the garden. The couple in the other cottage are also keen on living in a remote rural area although they both work in Cheltenham. They have a dog and two cats. There is electricity but no gas in the cottages. They have spring water so pay no water rates.
